content.description: To the immediate left of the main front roof you will see the pretty arete. Sit start with hands on either side of the arete on the flat seam/ledges. Work up tall arete and either trend right under the high protruding ledge, or work left between the top of the lob and the upper high roof.

A direct and distinctly different line sharing the same start as "Haunting the Black Air"Start as per Haunting and work into the crack under the roof. Match the rail out and to the right of the roof at the low lip (just left of the slot for "Black Air"). From there, climb direct to the lip by using the tiny crimp/s on the face directly above the rail. Mantle over the high flat ledge and slab up and over to walk off the back.

In the middle of the long rear face, facing the big wall. Look high on the face for the vertical side-pull. Stand start low below the side-pull on the lowest big ledge matched. Follow good holds upward to the side-pull, then top out.

To the right of the main front roof look for where the roof gets very low to the ground with a low sloper bulge. 

  Sit start matched on the bulge and work up the fun holds and slopers to where you are standing and can walk left along the ledge top either safely jump down or continue to top out as per "Haunting" further left.

A long, fun, easy traverse across the back face of the boulder.Stand start as per "Haunted Arete" and work low across the face to walk off at the far left end.You should do this one a few times before trying it with no hands.

A Guest River classic. 

  Under the main steep roof in the low back section find the obvious left facing jug flake. Sit start matched here. Work left to an undercling and higher edge. Link into the higher jug crack in the next roof tier. Reach out, left hand to the slim crimp slot.  

  Dyno up and right to the chunk gaston, match and toss to the higher ledge. Mantle over the high flat ledge and slab up and over to walk off the back.

Super easy and quite good. Do laps and warm up.On the uphill side of the boulder, this is the arete nearest the back wall.Hop up to stand on the big iron jug at the base, then ascend to the top with nice flat holds.
content.location: On the uphill side of the boulder, this is the arete nearest the back wall.

content.description: If you don't like balance and coordination challenges or having a good time in general, do not attempt. Otherwise, this is a great time.Stand start "Hillbilly Highway" with feet on the big iron flat chunk at the base. Without the use of your hands, complete the low traverse all the way across the face to walk off to the far left side.
On the back-most face, facing the big wall. Stand start about 4ft left of the arete on the large low juggy ledge. Cruise up through good rails directly to the easy top. Walk off left.

Around the corner from the roof section is a nice featured face.  Start on the large holds down low and move up and slightly right through the prominent features.  The huge chicken head jug and amazing right hand finger lock will move you up to the slopey top out.
content.location: Around the corner from the roof section is a nice featured face.  Start on the large holds down low

content.description:
The sit start for "Impact" 

  Look under the low roof below the sloper start for Impact and find the deep small jug and the nice rail beside it to the right.  

  Toss to the crimp and work on tot he sloper to finish as per "Impact"

A huge, wonderful boulder with a great approach. This is the first boulder you encounter from the approach into Jaybird from the top. Highly varied bouldering terrain here, with fun aretes, a massive roof, bulges and a long warm-up wall on the downhill side.
